abstract: Federal appeals court panel rejects request to delay lower court ruling outlawing changes to voting law in Wisconsin that were enacted by state's Republican-controlled Legislature; decision is important win for voting rights advocates, who claim changes are part of effort to suppress minority voting.
lead_paragraph: The ruling makes it likely that state and federal balloting in November will allow expanded early and weekend voting, among other changes.
snippet: The ruling makes it likely that state and federal balloting in November will allow expanded early and weekend voting, among other changes....

headline.main: Court’s Ruling in Wisconsin Seen as Victory for Voting Rights
headline.print_headline: Voting Rights Groups Cheer Ruling on a Wisconsin Law
